snp5.19:1.1: To anugāyati is to keep on reciting, as the brahmins did with their hymns descended from seers of old (as eg. AN 5.192:3.1). Here, Piṅgiya, as an experienced Vedic reciter himself, announces that he will keep the this teaching alive in just the same way. This is perhaps the most explicit evidence for a direct historical link between the oral recitation methods of the brahmins and the Buddhists.
